greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A276086(A276086(A276086(n))), where A276086(n) converts primorial base expansion of n into its prime product form.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..134
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
mathematica: Block[{b = MixedRadix[Reverse@ Prime@ Range@ 120], f}, f[n_] := Times @@ Power @@@ # &@ Transpose@ {Prime@ Range@ Length@ #, Reverse@ #} &@ IntegerDigits[n, b]; Array[Nest[f, #, 3] &, 23, 0]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 17 2019 *)
program: A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 15 2019
